refnamediv.refpurpose: The interface for sortable models used by GtkTreeView

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Known Implementations
refsect1.para: GtkTreeSortable is implemented by GtkTreeModelSort, GtkTreeStore and GtkListStore.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GtkTreeSortable is an interface to be implemented by tree models which support sorting. The GtkTreeView uses the methods provided by this interface to sort the model.

refsect2.title: GtkTreeSortableIface
GtkTreeIterCompareFunc ()
refsect2.para: A GtkTreeIterCompareFunc should return a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer if a sorts before b, a sorts with b, or a sorts after b respectively. If two iters compare as equal, their order in the sorted model is undefined. In order to ensure that the GtkTreeSortable behaves as expected, the GtkTreeIterCompareFunc must define a partial order on the model, i.e. it must be reflexive, antisymmetric and transitive.
For example, if model is a product catalogue, then a compare function for the "price" column could be one which returns price_of(a) - price_of(b).

listitem.simpara: The GtkTreeModel the comparison is within
A GtkTreeIter in model
Another GtkTreeIter in model
Data passed when the compare func is assigned e.g. by gtk_tree_sortable_set_sort_func()
A GtkTreeSortable

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_sortable_get_sort_column_id ()
refsect2.para: Fills in sort_column_id and order with the current sort column and the order. It returns TRUE unless the sort_column_id is GTK_TREE_SORTABLE_DEFAULT_SORT_COLUMN_ID or GTK_TREE_SORTABLE_UNSORTED_SORT_COLUMN_ID.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeSortable
The sort column id to be filled in
The GtkSortType to be filled in
TRUE if the sort column is not one of the special sort column ids.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_sortable_set_sort_column_id ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_sortable_set_sort_column_id (GtkTreeSortable *sortable, gint sort_column_id, GtkSortType order);
refsect2.para: Sets the current sort column to be sort_column_id. The sortable will resort itself to reflect this change, after emitting a GtkTreeSortable::sort_column_changed signal. If sort_column_id is GTK_TREE_SORTABLE_DEFAULT_SORT_COLUMN_ID, then the default sort function will be used, if it is set.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeSortable
the sort column id to set
The sort order of the column

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_sortable_set_sort_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_sortable_set_sort_func (GtkTreeSortable *sortable, gint sort_column_id, GtkTreeIterCompareFunc sort_func, gpointer user_data, GtkDestroyNotify destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets the comparison function used when sorting to be sort_func. If the current sort column id of sortable is the same as sort_column_id, then the model will sort using this function.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeSortable
the sort column id to set the function for
The comparison function
User data to pass to sort_func, or NULL
Destroy notifier of user_data, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_sortable_set_default_sort_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_sortable_set_default_sort_func (GtkTreeSortable *sortable, GtkTreeIterCompareFunc sort_func, gpointer user_data, GtkDestroyNotify destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets the default comparison function used when sorting to be sort_func. If the current sort column id of sortable is GTK_TREE_SORTABLE_DEFAULT_SORT_COLUMN_ID, then the model will sort using this function.

If sort_func is NULL, then there will be no default comparison function. This means that once the model has been sorted, it can't go back to the default state. In this case, when the current sort column id of sortable is GTK_TREE_SORTABLE_DEFAULT_SORT_COLUMN_ID, the model will be unsorted.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeSortable
The comparison function
User data to pass to sort_func, or NULL
Destroy notifier of user_data, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_sortable_has_default_sort_func ()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if the model has a default sort function. This is used primarily by GtkTreeViewColumns in order to determine if a model can go back to the default state, or not.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeSortable
TRUE, if the model has a default sort function
